intro: Agropyron vulpinum, commonly known as the mouse-eared grass, is a perennial grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands, rocky soils, and disturbed areas. The plant has slender, wiry stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, often with a bluish-green color. Agropyron vulpinum is characterized by its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
